exp_opt¶

This module contains the class ExpOpt, which provides a experiment interface for users.

Author:
Yu-Ren Liu
class exp_opt.ExpOpt[source]¶

The experiment entrance of the optimization.

__init__()[source]¶

Initialization.

static min(objective, parameter, repeat=1, best_n=None, plot=False, plot_file=None, seed=None)[source]¶

Minimization function.

Parameters:
  • objective – an Objective object
  • parameter – a Parameter object
  • repeat – integer, repeat times of the optimization
  • best_n – integer, ExpOpt.min will print average value and standard deviation of best_n optimal results among returned solution list.
  • plot – whether to plot regret curve during the optimization
  • plot_file – the file name to output the figure
  • seed – random seed of the optimization
Returns:

a best_solution set
static result_analysis(results, top)[source]¶

Get mean value and standard deviation of best ‘top’ results.

Parameters:
  • results – a list of results
  • top – the number of best results used to calculate mean value and standard deviation
Returns:

mean value and standard deviation of best ‘top’ results
